We knew that without some scribbler telling us so.
No doubt he was trying to put heart into you© 3bu have heard
pf our great general Napoleon© He was always addressing his
troops, to -put heart in them0
Got beat in the end, though, didn't he?
He did; but he knew that armies did not run on speeches© An
array, he once said, marches on its stomach©
Well, the General knew that too© He was the greatest man the

And he served only two terms as President: then he went b&cJr
to Mount Vernon and lived as a private gentleman©
DISTANT FIRECRACKERS
There they go with some more of those confounded firecrackers©
I hate the things© I'd rather be back in the retreat across
New Jersey than listen to those infernal contraptions© Every
Fourth of July this place is like a town under siege© One
rtamn fool after another firing off muskets from the front door,
and pistols from the window© Rockets come wfeizaing into your
bedroom; blazing grasshoppers jump at you on the sidewalk;
I3m scared to death the horses are going to bolt, and all us
